fields.headline: This week's new DVD & Blu-ray
fields.bodyText: Universal Classic Monsters There's no disputing the use of "classic" here: the eight films contained in this essential boxset have more than proven themselves over the years, in terms of enduring artistry as well as commercial value. These films put Universal Studios on the map and also kept them going through some very hard times. It's taken an age for them to get the hi-def, Blu-ray treatment, but the wait is justified when you see what a truly amazing job has been done here. They look alive … ALIVE! Dracula, Frankenstein, The Bride Of Frankenstein, The Wolf Man, The Creature From The Black Lagoon (with a 3D version included), The Mummy, The Invisible Man, The Phantom Of The Opera: these films, spanning the 1930s to 50s, are an entertaining crash-course in film history and a much-needed slap in the face to those who think old means boring and slow. The studio system has been subject to a lot of bad-mouthing over the years, but these films show how it actually used to be a good thing. Directors like James Whale, actors like Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi and Claude Rains, makeup men like Jack Pierce … all these talents did their best work for Universal; the flat-headed Karloff Frankenstein's monster is one of the defining images of cinema. They're playful, odd and experimental movies with an amazing hand-crafted feel; far from the smug and scare-free stuff that passes as horror these days. Blu-ray, Universal Bond 50 Ah, come in all 22 James Bond movies on Blu-ray – we've been expecting you. A great value 50th anniversary boxset. Blu-ray, MGM Das Testament Des Dr Mabuse Fritz Lang's compelling and cryptic classic about an insane criminal mastermind. Blu-ray & DVD, Eureka Spartacus: Vengeance All the gory glory of the Roman empire, Spartacus delivers another perfect season of mayhem and intrigue. Blu-ray & DVD, Anchor Bay Fringe Season 4 Parallel worlds collide as this great science-fiction show continues to explore its unique mythology. Blu-ray & DVD, Warner
